alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 11 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND EAST CENTRAL RED RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM CST... At 907 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Boxelder, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Foreman, De Kalb, Winthrop, Arkinda, Avery, Bokhoma, Almont, Moon, Cerrogordo, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Harris, Shinewell, English, Wallace, Tom, Arden, and America. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
